TITLE.P: Manufactory and delivery of 2 complete coring systems

SHORT_DESCR.P: The scope of supply consists of a wireline coring string and two complete coring systems for coring / drilling operations to a depth of over 2'000m. The operator has the intention to devide the coring string in that way, that he uses the string in both coring systems. Contractor should offer the complete set of coring equipment, including spare parts and consumables.
All materials to be supplied with material certificates DIN EN 10204 3.1 and 3.2.
The contractor has to supply to the operator all certificates according to DIN EN ISO 11961 Annex D: latest edition.

INFO_ADD.P: This is the planned opening date. The opening is not public.
Conditions for countries not party to the WTO agreement: None, as far as respective country grants equivalent counter-rights.
Terms of business: The general terms and conditions of Nagra apply (see https://www.nagra.ch/en/gtc.htm) No terms and conditions of contractor are accepted.

Basic procedural principles: The operator will sign the contract only with partners, which commit to comply with the occupational health and safety regulations and working conditions valid for employees in Switzerland and in the specific location for the performance of the work, as well as with the existing regulations. Furthermore, for the services performed in Switzerland under the Project or the work, the contractor commits to maintain wage equality for men and women.
Additional information: Nagra reserves the right to freely award further similar tasks related to this basic contract (submission decree of the canton of Aargau § 8, para. 3, lit. i).
Procedures for appeal: Right to appeal:

1. This order may be filed within a non-extendable period of 10 days from the date of publication at the Administrative Court of the Canton of Aargau, Obere Vorstadt 40, 5001 Aarau. The standstill of the deadlines according to civil procedure law does not apply.
2. The complaint must be submitted in written form and must include an application and a statement of reasons. That means it has to be:
(a) stated how the administrative court should decide; and
(b) explained why this other decision is required.
3. A complaint that does not comply with the requirements of paragraphs 1 and 2 will not be processed.
4. The contested call for tender must be specified, any evidence must be identified and enclosed, as far as possible. The entry is to be signed.
5. The complaint procedure involves a cost risk, ie the unsuccessful party usually has to pay the costs of the proceedings and, if applicable, the adversarial costs of the claimant.
Deadline / remarks: Offers must arrive at the operator’s premises by above deadline. Delayed offers or those sent by e-mail or fax will not be processed.

Remarks (Desired deadline for questions in written form) Questions (in English or German) are to be posted exclusively at www.simap.ch in the “Forum" of the present call for tenders where the Questions also will be answered. Questions posted after 16.3.2018 will not be answered.
